title: Plate, "Airplane", ca. 1920
markings: Marks: On underside: Imperial Porcelain Factory mark for Nicholas II with 1896 stamped in green underglaze; hammer, sickle, cog hand-painted in blue overglaze
provenance: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection
creditline: The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds
description: Circular, with notched gilded border and in the center a scene showing a stylized airplane flown by a young man and woman, a red flying carpet, a couple dressed in medieval costume, a chained ogre, caged birds

tombstone.epitaph:
Plate, "Airplane", ca. 1920.
ca. 1920. porcelain, enamel, gilding. The Henry and Ludmilla Shapiro Collection; Partial gift and partial purchase through the Decorative Arts Association Acquisition and Smithsonian Collections Acquisition Program Funds. 1989-41-12.
